servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

ptxt.emph: P2127: Throttle/Pedal Position Sensor/Switch “E” Circuit Low Input

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of APP sensor (sub) signal circuit is lower than 0.23 V.

ptxt.emph: P2128: Throttle/Pedal Position Sensor/Switch “E” Circuit High Input

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of APP sensor (sub) signal circuit is higher than 2.4 V.

s1.ptxt: Turn ignition switch to ON position.
Keep accelerator pedal at fully depressed position for 2 sec.
Keep accelerator pedal at release position for 2 sec.

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:J24B .

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal assembly (with APP sensor) mounting check

test1.ptxt: Check that accelerator pedal assembly (with APP sensor) has been mounted to vehicle body properly (no pinched floor carpet, etc.).

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Reinstall accelerator pedal assembly (with APP sensor) properly.

testgroup.title: APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch and disconnect connector from accelerator pedal assembly (with APP sensor).
Check for proper terminal connection to electric accelerator pedal assembly (with APP sensor) connector.
If connections are OK, turn ignition switch to ON position.
Check that voltage between APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit (B1) and ground circuit (B3) is 5 V.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

testgroup.title: APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Check that voltage between APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit (B1) and vehicle body ground is 5 V.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

paragroup.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.
If this DTC is detected again, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

testgroup.title: APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit check

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch and disconnect connectors from ECM.
Check for proper terminal connection to ECM connectors.
If connections are OK, check that APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit (B1) is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit is less than 3 Ω.
Insulation resistance of APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit is infinity between accelerator pedal assembly (incorporated with APP sensor) connector and vehicle body ground.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit terminal and each terminal at APP sensor connector.
Circuit voltage of APP sensor (sub) power supply circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch in ON position.

testgroup.question: Is it in good condition?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
Repair or replace defective wire harness.

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch and disconnect connectors from ECM.
Check for proper terminal connection to ECM connectors.
If connections are OK, check that APP sensor (sub) signal circuit (B2) is as follows.

item.ptxt: Wiring harness resistance of APP sensor (sub) signal circuit is less than 3 Ω.
Insulation resistance of APP sensor (sub) signal circuit is infinity between accelerator pedal assembly (with APP sensor) connector and vehicle body ground.
Insulation resistance of wire harness is infinity between APP sensor (sub) signal circuit terminal and each terminal at accelerator pedal assembly (with APP sensor) connector.
Circuit voltage of APP sensor (sub) signal circuit is 0 – 1 V with ignition switch in ON position.

action.ptxt: Repair or replace defective wire harness.
Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
Replace accelerator pedal assembly (with APP sensor).
